official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize
		  appointment of Doctors of Chiropractic to regular and reserve corps of the
		  Public Health Service Commissioned Corps, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Chiropractic Membership in the Public
			 Health Service Commissioned Corps Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Doctors of
			 Chiropractic in the Public Health Service Commissioned Corps

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 207(a)(1) of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 207 of the Public
			 Health Service Act

header.#text:
Authorization of
			 appointment of Doctors of Chiropractic

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall be eligible for
				appointment as officers in the commissioned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Ready Reserve
				Corps of the Public Health Service

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				ensure that such Doctors of Chiropractic are trained, equipped, and otherwise
				prepared to fulfill applicable public health and emergency response service
				responsibilities in the Commissioned
				Corps.

text.#text:
Doctors of Chiropractic who are graduates
				of colleges of chiropractic whose graduates are eligible for licensure to
				practice chiropractic in a majority of the States of the United States, or
				approved by a body or bodies acceptable to the

header.#text:
Required
			 placement of Doctors of Chiropractic into Public Health Service Commissioned
			 Corps

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall commence the appointment of no
			 fewer than 6 Doctors of Chiropractic into the commissioned
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
Ready Reserve Corps of the Public Health Service

text.#text:
Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Energy and Commerce of the
			 House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
quarterly reports on all measures taken by the
			 President, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Health Education Labor and
			 Pensions of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to carry out the provisions of this Act, including the amendments made by this
			 Act. The first such report shall be submitted not later than 120 days after the
			 date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

Department of Health and
			 Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chiropractic Membership in Public Health Service Commissioned Corps Act of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#tail:
is authorized and shall be made available in each of
			 such fiscal years only for the salaries and expenses necessary

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Out of the
			 total aggregate appropriations made available to the
